paper_abstract: We investigate the computational complexity of the empire colouring problem (as defined by Percy Heawood in Q. J. Pure Appl. Math. 24:332-338, 1890) for maps containing empires formed by exactly r > 1 countries each. We prove that the problem can be solved in polynomial time using s colours on maps whose underlying adjacency graph has no induced subgraph of average degree larger than s/r.
